name: Case Report
description: A case report is a detailed account of an individual patient's condition, diagnosis, treatment, and outcome. Case studies provide insights into rare or novel cases.

name: Cross Sectional Study
description: A cross-sectional study is an observational study that analyzes data from a population at a specific point in time.

name: Longitudinal Study
description: A longitudinal study involves repeated observations of the same variables over a period of time.

name: Meta Analysis
description: A meta-analysis is a statistical method for combining data from multiple studies to provide a pooled estimate of an effect.

name: Phase Clinical Trials
description: Clinical trials are conducted in phases (Phase 1 to Phase 4) to assess safety, efficacy, dosage, and post-marketing surveillance.

name: Pragmatic Clinical Trial
description: A pragmatic clinical trial evaluates the effectiveness of an intervention in real-world conditions.

name: Registry Study
description: A registry study involves long-term tracking of patients in a registry to monitor outcomes and safety over time.

name: Systematic Review
description: A systematic review is a structured literature review that synthesizes evidence from multiple studies on a specific research question.
